fields.description:
url: https://stash-dev.atlassian.com/projects/BLTZ/repos/best-repository---adam/browse/README.md
browser: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 9.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C)
fields.summary: Blame date tooltip should show full time

fields.description:
Log shows error:
{code}
2012-03-15 11:01:26,657 ERROR [http-7990-5]  c.a.s.internal.web.GlobalController There was an unhandled exception loading [/projects/QA/repos/qa/commits]
org.springframework.web.util.NestedServletException: Handler processing failed; nested exception is java.lang.StackOverflowError

	at org.springframework.web.servlet.DispatcherServlet.doService(DispatcherServlet.java:852) ~[spring-webmvc-3.1.1.RELEASE.jar:3.1.1.RELEASE]

Document how to update Stash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When sending an invitation to an e-mail address that does not have access to Bitbucket yet, to contribute on a workspace, if there isn't a Bitbucket Cloud account associated with that e-mail address, the user will be prompted to create a new account.

After setting up a new account for that e-mail address, the expected behavior would be that the user would also have access to the workspace they've just accepted the invitation to. 

The issue here is that, when accepting an invitation and you do not have a Bitbucket Cloud account yet, you will not automatically have access to the workspace you were invited to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Receive an invitation to contribute on a workspace on an e-mail address that you do not have a Bitbucket Cloud account on;
 # Accept the invitation;
 # Go through the new Bitbucket Cloud account set up process;
 # After the account is created, if you go to "All workspaces", the workspace you just accepted the invitation to will not be there

h3. Expected Results
When accepting an invitation as a user that does not have a Bitbucket Cloud account yet, it's expected that you would have access to the workspace you accepted the invitation to.

h3. Actual Results
After accepting the invitation to the workspace as a new Bitbucket Cloud user, you do not have access to the workspace.

h3. Workaround
If you go to your e-mail and accept the invitation from the same e-mail message a second time, you will be redirected to Bitbucket to complete the invitation acceptance process. After accepting the invitation as an existing Bitbucket user, you will have access to the workspace in question.
fields.summary: Access to workspace is not granted if the invited e-mail does not have a Bitbucket account associated with it

fields.description:
It would be nice to have an option to chose which artifacts I want to use in each step.
e.g. Let's say I have Step 1 where I produce artifact A and artifact B. Later, I need only artifact A for step 2, and only artifact B for step 3.
At the moment, both artifacts are downloaded, being able to chose would save some build time, while also saving some bandwith.
fields.summary: Being able chose which artifacts are downloaded in a step

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users have the ability to run a pipeline manually
 - either from the Pipelines page of a repo > Run pipeline
 - or from the commit view: when viewing a commit, there is a "Run pipeline" option
 - or from the Branches page of the repo: select Actions for a branch > Run pipeline for a branch

This option allows users to select one pipeline to run at a time.
If they want to run multiple pipelines, they'll need to select "Run pipeline" X times (where X is the number of pipelines they want to run).

This process can be tedious, especially for users who have multiple custom pipelines only and make use of the "Run pipelines" option to trigger their builds.
h3. Suggested Solution

In the "Run pipeline" dialog, allow users to select multiple pipelines to run.
h3. Workaround

The only workaround at the moment would be to create a script that uses our API to trigger a pipeline:

[https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/rest/api-group-pipelines/#api-repositories-workspace-repo-slug-pipelines-post]

and in that script include X API calls (where X is the number of pipelines you want to trigger), one for each pipeline.
fields.summary: Allow users to select multiple pipelines when they use the "Run pipelines" option

fields.description: Currently, we only send email notifications for a failed build. Customer is requesting a feature or ability for them to configure a custom notification for specific failure such as an error code in the build log.
fields.summary: Custom pipeline notification
Atlassian Access integration - Allow organization managed accounts personal information requests to be pulled via the API as an org admin

fields.description:
It's currently not possible to use an image in the Bitbucket pipleline, that doesn't have `/usr/bin/mkfifo` or `/bin/echo`, resulting in the error:

```

/bin/sh: /usr/bin/mkfifo: No such file or directory

/bin/sh: /bin/echo: No such file or directory

```

 

An example for this is the [Nix-Image]([https://hub.docker.com/r/nixos/nix),] or basically any image coming out of [Nixery]([https://nixery.dev/)]

 

If these commands are really needed for the pipline, I suggest to at least check if they're somewhere in the PATH first, before using the hardcoded location. But best would be if they're not needed or somehow passed into the container, so the container doesn't have to have a specific form.

 

This would help us a lot. And the ability to use nixery would be a dream!

Thanks for investigating this!
fields.summary: Do not hardcode expected location for mkfifo, echo and propably other stuff

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When writing a description in a pull request that includes bullet points, if the list contains more than one bullet point and the line contains a code block, the bullet point will disappear (does not happen for the first bullet point).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Write a description with bullet points that contain code block lines made with single ticks (`).
!Screen Shot 2021-12-16 at 11.41.29 AM.png|width=556,height=286!
 # Save the description.
!Screen Shot 2021-12-16 at 11.41.43 AM.png|width=611,height=206!
 # Reload the page and notice the missing bullet point.
!Screen Shot 2021-12-16 at 11.42.00 AM.png|width=586,height=206!

h3. Expected Results

All bullet points should remain.
h3. Actual Results

Bullet point disappears.
 # !image-2022-01-03-08-24-22-175.png|width=586,height=206!

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Putting a code tag on a line in a bulleted list causes the bullet to disappear

fields.description:
I'd like to suggest a way to show that "Ignore Whitespace Changes" is enabled from the PR View.

The reason for this is in a scenario :
 * The user does not check "PR Preferences" and aren't aware of which PR Preferences is enabled 
 ** In this scenario, Ignore Whitespace Changes" is enabled. 
 * The diff of a file only contains whitespace changes.

This results in the PR diff showing a message :
{code:java}
Empty Diff
The diff for this file is empty
{code}
This result, gives users the perspective which can be misleading that the PR is generating an empty diff incorrectly while not being aware that PR Preferences is "Ignoring Whitespaces".
fields.summary: Make message clearer if diff shows up as empty when "ignore whitespaces" is enabled
Malware Abuse

fields.description:
In PR list page (like [https://bitbucket.org/another-account/git-repo/pull-requests]) , it shows PR titles, and we have to click to PR to get detail informaitons.

However, it is not always easily to get/remind context by titles, esp. when it's about an issue need long steps to reproduce.

I would suggest to show some detail info from PR content, kind of first 100 or 200 chars in small font followed by titiles.

This feature would help us to know PR content without click in and read full page.
fields.summary: Offer more information about PR

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating a pull request, the option to "Delete Branch (source)" is greyed out for the main branch. but while merging a pull request "close source branch" option is not greyed out for the main branch.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a pull request with the source branch as the main branch
 # Click on "merge", it should allow you to select "close source branch" for the main branch.

eg: master is the main branch, it still allows you to select the option "close source branch"
----
 

!Screenshot 2021-12-29 at 3.49.09 PM.png|width=383,height=359!
----
But even if the option "close source branch" is selected in the case of the main branch, pull request merge will fail with an error "Merge failed: Cannot close the source branch because it is the main branch of the repository."

It would be better to grey out the option "close source branch" for the main branch and display the message "close the source branch option is not available because it is the main branch of the repository", rather than allowing users to select the option and then failing the pull request merge.
h3. Expected Results

The option "close source branch" should be greyed out for the main branch.
h3. Actual Results

It still allows users to select the option "close source branch" for the main branch.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. But even if the option "close source branch" is selected in the case of the main branch, pull request merge will fail with an error "Merge failed: Cannot close the source branch because it is the main branch of the repository."
fields.summary: while merging a pull request "close source branch" option is not greyed out when source is the main branch

fields.description:
Currently the editor on Bitbucket tries to auto-hyperlink when identify content that is likely an URL, but sometimes this behavior is undesirable, and the link is wrongly created for file extensions like the example below :

!image-2021-12-27-14-56-35-894.png|width=324,height=195!

Also, there are a lot of country code top-level domains that are
not desirable to be auto detected for some customer.

It would be great if the editor had editable properties to filter/config domains that should/should not be auto hyperlinked.
fields.summary: Editor hyperlink input rule to support configuration/changes

fields.description:
Currently, the [Bitbucket Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/reviewing-a-pull-request-808488540.html] PRs User experience is different from Bitbucket Cloud. 

The request is to have a similar interface in Bitbucket Cloud with improved UX design.
fields.summary: Improving the User Experience Design in Pull Requests

fields.description:
I've struggled to trace back to the origin of a particular section of code when it has gone through a few iterations (often a combination of whitespace and functional changes).  I've used several Git clients that support a "Blame Previous" option, but the Bitbucket UI doesn't seem to expose one.

The Blame action on an individual commit page seems like it might have been intended to facilitate that, but several sections of the diff don't contain links back to the commit in which they originated, and even following those that do, it puts me into another view of the diff of that commit, from which I have to explicitly click into the Blame view again.

GitHub has a "Blame Previous" action on each element of the diff that will jump to a blame of the version that preceded that particular change (see [documentation here|[https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/working-with-files/using-files/tracking-changes-in-a-file])] and TortoiseGit also offers a "Blame previous" ([documentation here|[https://tortoisegit.org/docs/tortoisegit/tgit-dug-blame.html]).]  I see it was also a request for SourceTree as well (SRCTREEWIN-641) but seemed to fall short in that implementation, where it was just easy to blame each version in the version log of an individual file, but you are still shooting in the dark when a file has a long version history.

So, the GitHub and TortoiseGit examples are the models in my mind of how this could/should work and facilitate commit research.
fields.summary: Provide a clear path to "Blame Previous" commit for a particular diff element

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

multiline code blocks get mangled into 1 line when tried to embed them in a list. The issue occurs in the pull request description editor, pull request comments editor.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Open a pull request.
2) In the description box, add a bullet or a numbered list. 
3) From one of those dots or number, <shift>-<enter> to a new line and click the 'code snippet' option
4) select any language and paste a valid *multi-line* code/query
5) save
6) depending on how the to save was executed, a page reload may be needed to see the state where the code/query was mangled into a 1-line state
h3. Expected Results

!Screenshot 2021-12-23 at 7.49.30 PM.png|width=611,height=146!
h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot 2021-12-23 at 7.55.08 PM.png|width=592,height=97!
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: multiline code blocks get mangled into 1 line when tried embed them in a list
Clicking on the Users on plan link from a repository access settings will break the UI when the user does not have workspace admin access

fields.description:
Can not push to remote: {noformat} Writing objects: 100% (70/70), 5.50 KiB | 5.50 MiB/s, done. Total 70 (delta 41), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0 remote: Checking connectivity: 12 remote: Checking connectivity: 70, done. remote: remote: remote: 504 Gateway Time-out remote: remote: remote: remote:

504 Gateway Time-out

remote: remote: remote: remote: remote: error: failed to push some refs to 'bitbucket.org:[...].git' To bitbucket.org:[...].git ! refs/heads/dev:refs/heads/dev [remote rejected] (pre-receive hook declined) Done{noformat}
fields.summary: Allow to push change to your server | 504 Gateway Time-out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket cloud decompresses files with extension ".img.gz" to their original size when downloaded from UI. when users try to extract the downloaded file with .img.gz" extension, they get an invalid file format error.

!Screenshot 2021-12-22 at 1.43.48 PM.png|width=366,height=120!

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # download a sample file with .img extension or you can rename a text file to .img extension
 # gzip the .img file and push it to the remote Bitbucket repository.
 # when we click on "view raw file" from the repo UI, it decompresses the .img.gz file to its original size and downloads it to your local machine.
 # The downloaded file cannot be opened, it will throw an "invalid file format" error.

h3. Expected Results

It should download the file without decompressing it.
h3. Actual Results

Bitbucket cloud decompresses files with extension ".img.gz" to their original size when downloaded from UI

h3. Workaround

We need to rename the downloaded file from "img.gz" to ".img" to view it.
fields.summary: Bitbucket cloud decompresses files with extension ".img.gz" to their original size when downloaded from UI

fields.description: Ability in Bitbucket cloud to consistently trace the parent branch/branches of a specific branch. Ideally this can be a default variable so that this data can be used in Bitbucket Pipelines to control builds based on the parent branch.
fields.summary: Trace parent branch or branches in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding/editing a pull request description and including a Bullet List/Numbered list, the subsequent items that include *code formatting* are collapsed after saving and refreshing the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add/Edit a pull request description
 # Include a Bullet list/Numbered list with multiple items, and add code formatting on some of them
!image-2021-12-21-15-24-40-754.png|width=307,height=202!
 # Click on save button, and the items will be showed correctly
!image-2021-12-21-15-25-52-438.png|width=355,height=210!
 # Refresh the page. The subsequent items that use code formatting are collapsed 
!image-2021-12-21-15-26-25-276.png|width=370,height=236!

h3. Expected Results

The items in the Bullet/Numbered list that use code formatting are correctly showed as individual items
h3. Actual Results

Subsequent items that use the code formatting are collapsed and shown as one single item.
h3. Workaround

Remove the code formatting when using Bullet/Numbered lists.
fields.summary: Pull Request Description Formatting: Adjacent List Items with Code Formatting are Collapsed

fields.description:
Some user uses code comments as a place of discussion and whenever a push happens to the source branch, this causes the comment to turn into an outdated comment and was hidden which hinder the collaboration in the code. 

So an ability to disable this would be a great feature to be added
fields.summary: Ability to disable outdated comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating or editing a comment on a pull request, a numbered list can be created. This list looks correct while editing, but after saving all numbers except the first are removed. The list looks correct in the email notification.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start a comment on a line in a diff on a pull request
 # Add a numbered list with more than one item to the comment
 # Save the comment

h3. Expected Results

Comment will contain numbered list with numbers in front of each list item
h3. Actual Results

Comment contains a list but with only the number 1 in front of the first list item
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Numbered lists in comments lose their numbers when saved

fields.description:
Workspace Admins should have the option to disable the user's id. In JIRA, there is a button to disable ids.

It will be helpful to have the facility, where they can perform ID validation within the workspace based on the inactivity of users.
fields.summary: Admins have the ability to disable user id's in workspace

fields.description:
For me, as a user, it would be great to have a list of the workspace repositories for quick access since there is a vast amount of unused space, and quite often a necessity to hop between repositories as efficiently as possible

 

!image-2021-12-17-13-28-12-323.png!
fields.summary: List Workspace Repositories in Sidebar for quick access

fields.description:
As of now, users would need to specify `runs-on:` in each individual step in `bitbucket-pipelines.yml` in order for all their build steps to run on runners.

It will be best to have the ability to specify default `runs-on` config (probably under `options:` section) to allow all build to use the default `runs-on` config.
This will help reduce overhead while updating the yml config and avoid users configuring the incorrect `runs-on` config.

Sample configuration suggestion:
{code}
options:
    runs-on: ['self.hosted']
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to specify `runs-on` globally to allow all build runs on Runner by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users are removed from the repo when there is change in Main branch
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Observe the users having access under "Repository Settings" > "User and Group access"
# Navigate to "Repository Details" > Advanced > Change the "Main branch"
# Go back to "User and Group access", all the users and groups except Admins/admin groups will be removed from the repo

h3. Expected Results
Users access shouldn’t be changed
h3. Actual Results
All the users and groups except Admins/admin groups will be removed from the repo


h3. Workaround
To reinvite the users
fields.summary: Users are removed from the repo when there is change in Main branch

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Observe the users having access under "Repository Settings" > "User and Group access"
* Navigate to "Repository Details" > Advanced > Change the "Main branch"
* Go back to "User and Group access", all the users and groups except Admins/admin groups will be removed from the repo

Expected Results:
Users access shouldn’t be changed

Actual Results:
All the users and groups except Admins/admin groups will be removed from the repo

Workaround :
To reinvite the users
fields.summary: Users are removed from the repo when there is change in Main branch

fields.description: Current behavior is that the hyperlinks in SVG files are not clickable. It would be better to have the ability to click the link to navigate to the external site rather than having to copy-paste the URL.
fields.summary: Cannot render URL Links embedded in SVG files

fields.description: Currently, there is no 2.0 API to delete the links from the repositories. There is a need to have such an API for the customers who would like to delete the links from a large number of repositories and removing them manually is a very time consuming process.
fields.summary: Provide 2.0 API to delete the specified links from the repository

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Groups of Users to have delete permissions or not

h3. Expected Results
Separate which users will be able to delete branches

h3. Actual Results
Everyone or nobody delete branches
fields.summary: Groups of Users to have delete permissions or not

fields.description:
*Summary:* "504 Timeout" error while creating a PR
*Description:* When the repo has large number of branches, it causes issue while creating a PR since higher number of branches might take a lot of time to be retrieved and get populated in the source and target dropdown of the new PUll request UI.

It would be better to have a user-friendly notification since "504 Timeout" error doesn’t help customers understand the actual issue.
fields.summary: User friendly message required when there are more branches on the repo

fields.description: It'll be great if the Bitbucket Notebook Viewer can allow users to render Notebook files (such as .ipynb files) within the diff view between commits.
fields.summary: Allow Bitbucket Notebook Viewer to render Notebook files in diff view.

fields.description:
Currently, users need to manage the fork at the repositories level. If they do not wish to enable fork for the repository, they can do it by updating the same in the repository settings.



The suggestion is to manage forks at the workspace level. With this option, it lets users easily manage fork options for all the repositories created at the workspace level.
fields.summary: Fork Management

fields.description:
Firebase hosting provides the ability to deploy to preview channels, as opposed to the primary live hosting deployment.  It would be very useful to add this feature to the Firebase Deploy integration for Bitbucket Pipelines so we can do things like deploy preview channels for PRs or for staging/QA.

[[Firebase Preview Channel Docs||https://firebase.google.com/docs/hosting/test-preview-deploy?authuser=0#preview-channels] [https://firebase.google.com/docs/hosting/test-preview-deploy?authuser=0#preview-channels] [] |https://firebase.google.com/docs/hosting/test-preview-deploy?authuser=0#preview-channels]
fields.summary: Support preview channels in Firebase Deploy integration

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior

Currently, it's not possible to rename a build.

h3. Suggestion

Please add the option to rename a build on Pipelines.
fields.summary: Add the option to rename a build

fields.description: This is an enhancement request on our ability to generate logs for end users. We would like to have the possibility to export the date of creation and the last commit date for each repository in a given workspace. This data could be relevant in some auditions/assessments, it would be great to have a button to do it on the UI or an endpoint in the API for the effort.
fields.summary: Export date of creation of each repository and last commit date.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Cannot commit sample YAML file while creating the first pipeline. When clicked on commit button the page load indefinitely 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click create my first pipeline from "pipelines" page 
 # It redirects to the editor 
 #  Click "commit" and it loads infinitely
 # Refresh the page and it takes back to source page

h3. Expected Results
The pipeline should be created 

h3. Actual Results
Pipeline is not created 

h3. Workaround
Add/commit a "bitbucket-pipelines.yml" file on the repo so that pipelines can be enabled
fields.summary: Commit option on creation of pipelines page loads infinitely

fields.description:
Currently, when more than one runner is available to execute a given build step, there's no way to set a priority/order on which runner to use.

For example:

Let's say the customer have 2 self-hosted runners available to build their projects.

One runner is on a server much more powerful than the other, so it finishes jobs faster. It would be nice for Bitbucket Pipelines to use this one when it's free, and only use the 2nd one on the rare occasions when the 1st is already running a job.
fields.summary: Allow to set priority/order of which runner to use in Pipelines

fields.description: I would really like the ability to pin a repository to the dashboard show that it always shows on the dashboard instead of only having the most recent show
fields.summary: Pin favorite repo's to dashboard

fields.description:
!image-2021-12-09-19-37-54-289.png!
With this setting on, there would be no such collapsed sections in diffs
fields.summary: Add an option to pull request settings to show diffs without unchanged sections collapsed

fields.description: Vue supports a single file component with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript contained in one file ([https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/single-file-components.html).] It would be helpful to see these sections use the appropriate syntax highlighting when reviewing source code in Bitbucket.
fields.summary: .vue single file component syntax highlighting

fields.description:
Hi, at my company we would like to have a "Spectators" feature in Pull Requests meaning being able to notify some people of changes, but without expected them to do a review.

Thanks.
fields.summary: "Spectators" in addition to "Reviewers" in Pull Requests

fields.description: PR page as in at the URL `https://bitbucket.org/<org>/<repo>/pull-requests/<number>`
fields.summary: `Give Feedback` button on PR page seems to be broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the atlassian/aws-sam-deploy:1.3.1 Pipe to deploy PackageType: Image

h3. Expected Results
Should deploy into ECR
h3. Actual Results
Doesn't deploy into ECR. Also, incorrectly mention that it has deployed into the S3 bucket

h3. Workaround
* Use the AWS CLI directly (i.e. using sam package and sam deploy commands in their build script). Fastest option.
* Wait until we add support for PackageType: Image in the pipe.
fields.summary: Support for PackageType: Image in aws-sam-deploy Pipe

fields.description:
Currently, we have "email alias" option under personal settings and this option cannot be managed by org admins.
Using alias developers will be able to commit using an email that is not their main address given by org. 
Hence it would be helpful if org admins had an option to disable the email alias option for users.
fields.summary: Allow Org admins to disable email alias option

fields.description: Currently, only the owner user can reset his own MFA, it would be interesting to an organization that an ORG admin is able to manually reset/disable his workspace users MFA
fields.summary: Add the ability to a admin reset a user MFA

fields.description: Currently, in Repository Settings, Repository Details it is possible to see the size of a repository, but there is not the same functionality for Workspace. It would be nice to have a way to analyze the total size of a Workspace.
fields.summary: Workspace storage usage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's not possible to see the repositories permissions through the API when you have multiple repositories under a workspace. 
Error message: "Something went wrong"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # You'll need to test this in a workspace with multiple repositories (problem occurred in a workspace with 900+ repositories)
 # Execute the following request:
{code:java}
curl -s --user user:Apppassword https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/workspaces/{workspace}/permissions/repositories?pagelen=10&page=1{code}

h3. Expected Results

You'll see the repositories permissions
h3. Actual Results

You receive the following error message:
{code:java}
{"type": "error", "error": {"message": "Something went wrong", "id": "XXX"}}%{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It's not possible to get the repositories permission through the API when you have multiple repositories under the workspace

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is a rare situation where after clicking on "Merge" option in a Pull request, the merge commit is created when the merge completes successfully on git but fails to report back to get the PR updated as "Merged" in the UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Merge a pull request
 # Sometimes the UI will show a failure or no activity
 # Merge commit will be created but the PR will still be in the status "Open"

h3. Expected Results

Pull request is in the correct state (Merged) after the merge was successful and the merge commit was created.
h3. Actual Results

Pull request keeps in the "Open" state even though the merge was successful on git. 
h3. Workaround

Customer can contact support providing the PR and merge commit ID, and we can mark it as merged.
fields.summary: Merging the pull request completes successfully but the pull request still open

fields.description: Currently runners doesn't allow to use the host's environmental variables. There are some cases when it would be a useful feature to allow Bitbucket runner to access the host's variables. An example can be read on the following site: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-Pipelines-questions/Access-private-runner-host-environment-variables/qaq-p/1859496
fields.summary: Allow Bitbucket runner to access host's environmental variable

fields.description: Would like to report on how many times a repo has been cloned.  Information doesn't seem to be accessible currently.
fields.summary: Cloned repo metrics

fields.description: Is it possible to add different shades of green for changes in PR page. suppose we have added 10 lines to a file in one commit and later changed 2 lines of them a subsequent commit. Is it possible to show the the newer lines in a more distinct shade of green color?
fields.summary: Different shades of Green in View/Diff PR page, for showing fresh commits vs. older ones

fields.description:
Hi,

We recently went from Jira OnDemand SVN to Git on BitBucket.

One thing we miss alot, is the ability to demand users entering a Jira issue key, when checking in code.

I know that Git is distributed, and a lot of the checkin/commit stuff is handled locally.\\
But if i Jira issue check was done by BitBucket, no code could be added to "final destination" without an Jira issue key defined in the commit description.

So this feature request is, that you possibly come up with a clever idea for this :o)

Best regards\\
Peter Meyer
fields.summary: Ability to reject commit without an issue key but only for selected branches
Bring back git fetch when making new branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

PR comment modal from Activity disappears when `Reply` has been clicked while scrolling
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # PR where a file has been removed but has comments
 # 
 ## Create PR with FileA
 ## Leave comments on FileA
 ## Remove FileA
 # Go to Activity tab and view the comments on the removed file
 # Resize window so it has to scroll within the modal
 # Click reply on comment
 # Scroll the model from top to bottom, it will automatically get dismised

h3. Expected Results

Modal to not automatically get dismissed
h3. Actual Results

Modal gets dismissed automatically when scrolling down.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing comments on removed files via activity tab on PR, modal gets dismissed sometimes

fields.description: The customer is requesting an ability to use their own custom domain name in Bitbucket, maybe we can introduce this on Enterprise level/plan.
fields.summary: Ability to use custom domain name

fields.description:
Issue Summary
Have more granular control on User access, restrict users from downloading from a repository

Expected:
Currently, even with read-only access, users can download the source code
However, it would be better to have more granular control over what users can do with, commenting on commits,  downloading code, etc.

Actual Results
Any user can download code.

Workaround
Currently, the only way would be removing the access of the user from the repo
fields.summary: Have more granular control on User access -  Ability to prevent a user to download code

fields.description:
This is a suggestion to add configurable command to feed to the text in the `copy to clipboard` buttons on the UI.

Currently, these buttons have "git checkout <branch name>".

Some users would prefer no "git checkout" or other options such as "git switch" or "git fetch && git checkout <branch name>". Perhaps these options can be configurable in the repository settings.
fields.summary: Configurable command in `copy to clipboard` buttons on the UI

fields.description: Today we have the Allowlisting IP addresses feature which allows us to limit the IPs that can access private repositories or other private content. It would be interesting to have a feature that would allow viewing the IPs that accessed the content or private repository when this feature Allowlisting IP is not enabled.
fields.summary: A way to check the IPs of users who accessed private content

fields.description:
In our team we deploy projects not only from inside the Bitbucket Pipelines, but also from local pc, running the same scripts. Usually we deploy locally in staging or development environments because we don't have to be so strict there and it's just faster to run script on pc with 16 Gb RAM than in Bitbucket Pipelines. The problem is to see what is actually deployed right not in staging or development, because when we deploy locally we don't affect Bitbucket Deployments and though they indicate a wrong state when we check them for staging or development.

My suggestion is to add a new Api under /deployments path here

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deployments

It should accept commit hash and maybe optionally release time and create a deployment release under this commit and passed or present time in Bitbucket Deployments.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Add a new api to create a deployment release to use it when deploying locally (not from pipeline)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While comparing branches using the "branch compare" option it doesn't show correct diff but instead, shows the diff result of the default (main) branch.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. create a new repo.
2. create a branch "master" with an empty Readme.md file
3. under 'Repository settings' -> 'Repository details' -> 'Advanced', make sure the main branch is "master"
4. create a new branch 'development' from master
5. add the letter A to your readme only on the development branch.
6. under 'Repository settings' -> 'Branching model', set your development branch as the specific branch 'development' and set the production branch to use main branch
7. create a new branch 'example' from development
8. add a B at the end of the readme on the example branch. It should now be 'AB'
9. go to the branches page
10. in the example branch's Actions menu, click 'Compare'

h3. Expected Results

Diff between development & example showing just that 'B' was added since the last commit

h3. Actual Results

Diff stating that the branches being compared are development & example, but showing diff between master and example.

h3. Workaround

After loading the diff, change the "destination" branch to a different branch and then change it back to the "destination" previously listed
(i) You will observe that the URL of the page will be updated showing that the correct branches are being compared.
fields.summary: Comparing branches using the "branch compare" option doesn't show correct diff

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior 
currently, we can only watch or stop watching Pull Requests to set the notifications we will receive 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we could limit the pull request notifications on a branch level instead of a repository level, 

h3. Business case: 

Some teams need a notification email to be sent when a pull request is merged to master and does not need a notification when a pull request is merged to other branches of the same repo
fields.summary: Add the ability to limit pull request notifications on a branch level instead of a repository level

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket runner 'runs-on' on statement on the YML file does not allow using variables (workspace, repository and deployment variables) to specify which runner to run, and throws the following error :

"There is an error in your bitbucket-pipelines.yml at [pipelines > custom > initial-testing > 0 > step]. To be precise: This runs-on label: $runner is invalid. Only alphanumeric characters and dots can be used in runs-on labels."
{code:java}
 - step:
name: Initial testing
runs-on:
- $runner {code}
Where: $runner is a deployment variable.

It would be nice to have the ability to use the variables to specify the runner label.
fields.summary: Ability to use a variable with Bitbucket runner 'runs-on' statement

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket only supports internal ticketing and JIRA ticketing systems and does not have any other external ticketing system.

It'd be great if we can support external ticketing systems.
fields.summary: Ability to link Bitbucket with external ticketing system

fields.description:
Currently, if you have invited a new user into a workspace's user group, the new user will need to sign up/register a new Bitbucket Cloud account first then click the invitation email again to accept the workspace invitation.

*Enhancement request:*
It would be great and user-friendly if new users need not to click the workspace invitation email twice because accepting the invitation email for the first time gives the impression that it will be automatically done.
fields.summary: Clicking workspace invitation email twice for new users

fields.description:
Currently, if you have invited a new user into a workspace's user group, the new user will need to sign up/register a new Bitbucket Cloud account first then click the invitation email again to accept the workspace invitation.

*Enhancement request:*
It would be great and user-friendly if new users need not to click the workspace invitation email twice because accepting the invitation email for the first time gives the impression that it will be automatically done.
fields.summary: Clicking workspace invitation email twice for new users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Removing a reviewer that has approved in the past should be allowed if there are no current approvals. Same as a reviewer who has requested changes in the past.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # User approves PR and reset PR approvals is enabled (this is a feature in branch permissions)
 # Push new changes to the PR to reset approval
 # Attempt to remove reviewer

h3. Expected Results

Reviewer is removed
h3. Actual Results

Error popup:
{noformat}
Something went wrong
Error: You cannot remove reviewers with status{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow removing a reviewer who was a past approver

fields.description: When the approval of a default reviewer is required, it would be helpful to have an indication of which reviewers on a pull request are default reviewers. This would make it easier to know who to ping to take a look at the pull request.
fields.summary: Provide indication of which reviewers are default reviewers on pull request view

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket Pipelines scan the test report files and return a failure for FlakyFailure presence. 

 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 

Suggestion: An option to set "flakyFailure" as a success while scanning the test results which would not result in a failed test indication.
fields.summary: Flaky Test Results

fields.description:
Enable "Blend", "Split" and  "Pixel Diff" option for Pull Request Diff. 

 !image-2021-11-30-11-53-13-226.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Blend Split Pixel Diff

fields.description:
I am able to read Pull request through Bitbucket API, but for me it will be complete - if i can get links of file attached to a Pull request.

 

If it is already available , please guide me to the link (for cloud aswell server versions)

 

Thanks
fields.summary: I use bitbucket REST APIs , I want to get/read attachments in Pull Requests

fields.description:
Currently, there's a security tab for Snyk integration and user wish to remove or hide it if they are not using the integration.

So an ability to hide or remove this tab would be a great option to add.
fields.summary: Ability to remove or hide security tab

fields.description:
At the moment it is possible to run the API call https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/workspaces/%7Bworkspace%7D/members and get the members of the workspace, however, the same currently return deactivated users, that are not listed under the "Users on Plan page" nor is it possible for us to identify these if not comparing the list of the users manually.

We would like that API call to have the "Active" flag on its output, so we can easily check if the user needs to be removed and from which repositories.
fields.summary: Flag deactivated users on the API results

fields.description:
In the Bitbucket Server product it is possible to configure HTTP access tokens for auth:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/personal-access-tokens-939515499.html]

It would be great to see this feature carried over to Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Add support for HTTP access tokens as available in Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Bitbucket Pipelines has the ability to decide whether to download ALL or none of the artifacts, it would be a useful feature to allow users to decide which artifacts they want to download in the step.

Current possibility:
{code:java}
artifacts:
 download: false # do not download artifacts in this step

artifacts:
 download: true # download ALL the artifacts in this step
{code}
Suggested possibility:
{code:java}
artifacts:
 download: file1.tar.gz, file2.tar.gz #to download ONLY certain files
{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to prevent a step from downloading a certain artifacts

fields.description: In Bitbucket, when pressing the `/` shortcut to access the search functionality, it'd be a great improvement to my user experience if I didn't have to lift my hands of the keyboard to click on the search input field. Please, give it a focus automatically.
fields.summary: Autofocus on search input

fields.description:
h3. Problem When adding a list of links, e.g. Jira issues, to a pull request description or comment it will display them incorrectly when the first word(s) of a list item are a link, it will break the rest of the text onto a new line. Chrome fares somewhat better than Firefox, but still breaks sentences out to multiple paragraphs when there is a link, Firefox will also display the list item as if there were a linebreak immediately preceding the link. h3. Causes The HTML for noted line items gets transformed to the following (formatting mine): {code:html}
  •      

                  The quick brown fox          

           

          should stop jumping over the dog  

    • {code} By wrapping a paragraph in a span it creates an invalid DOM tree as spans are inline elements that should not contain a block level element. By way of example, adding a {{display: block}} to the span that wraps the paragraph removes the additional space above links seen in Firefox. Note too that the text is transformed such that there are 2 paragraphs, this causes an unnecessary break in the sentence that surely wasn't intended by the author. h3. Steps to reproduce - Create or visit a pull request - During creating or editing of the description or comment add several list items with varying number of words (See screenshots) - Make the first word / only word / first several words of the text a link on some of the list items - Save the description or comment - You may need to refresh the page at this point to see the unfortunately rendered items. !image-2021-11-24-14-28-08-896.png!!image-2021-11-24-14-28-23-458.png!!image-2021-11-24-14-28-32-134.png!
fields.summary: BUG: On pull request comments and descriptions lists of links display with additional line breaks

fields.description:
When viewing a user from the "User directory" in the workspace settings, you can see (and remove) repositories that the user has direct access to. However, you are unable to remove groups in the same section. 

What would be really useful is being able to remove groups directly from a user in this screen without having to go in to each group, find the user, and remove them manually.

We manage access to every project with a set of groups, and if someone asks us to remove a user from a set of projects, this is a lot harder than it could, or should be. 

Thank you!

 

!image-2021-11-24-09-32-09-743.png!
fields.summary: The ability to remove groups from a user in the "User directory"

fields.description: When you want to search (at the far left on the screen below the Bitbucket logo) you need to click the search icon and then again need to click the search input. Can you make the input autofocus please.
fields.summary: When clicking on search => focus the search input

fields.description: The pull request description field appears to support much more than 2000 characters, but setting up a default PR Description will only let you input 2000 characters.
fields.summary: Default pull request descriptions should be able to be longer than 2000 characters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add a reviewer from the PR View page, the reviewer will not become a Watcher of the Pull request automatically, but they should.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a reviewer from the PR view page

h3. Expected Results

The reviewer should be automatically added as a watcher for the PR
h3. Actual Results

The reviewer doesn't automatically get added as a watcher for the PR
h3. Workaround
 * Add reviewer at the time of creating of PR or,
 * Edit the PR and add the reviewer there
fields.summary: Adding a Reviewer from PR view page doesn't add them as watcher
Add Project KEY to Repository URL like Bitbucket Server

fields.description: We are interested in a way of removing SSH access keys in bulk mode for all repositories or workspaces.
fields.summary: Remove access key in bulk mode.

fields.description: Bitbucket pipelines deployments don't show the linked JIRA issues for the first deployment.
fields.summary: Deployments don't show linked JIRA issues sometimes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever a deployment is performed and Jira issues are mentioned on the commits of that deployment, these deployments should appear in the dev panel of Jira.
However, when the deployment has more than 100 commits, there is a hard limit that causes some Jira issues from that deployment to not receive the update from Bitbucket's Jira integration about that deployment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate a Bitbucket Cloud workspace with Jira Cloud
 # In Bitbucket, create a deployment to a branch that contains more than 100 commits in it. Some of these commits need to have a Jira ticket linked to them.
 # Some commits will not add the proper reference to the deployment in Jira's dev panel.

h3. Expected Results
All commits that reference Jira tickets in Bitbucket that are part of a deployment will add a reference to the deployment in Jira after the deployment is completed.

h3. Actual Results
Intermittently commits that mention Jira issues which are part of a certain deployment will not update Jira with the deployment reference.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Bitbucket's Jira integration fails to send deployment information to Jira when the deployment has more than 100 commits

fields.description:
Currently, SSH keys generated by PuttyGen are not supported by Bitbucket, impacting the windows users' ability to use these on their account.

We would like to have this option available for us as currently when we try to add keys generated that way we only receive the following message on the UI:

* That SSH key is invalid.
fields.summary: Please support SSH keys generated by PuttyGen

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to for Pipelines to have a build trigger definition that automatically identifies the main branch, and if there is a change on it, trigger a Pipelines build.

The reason for this is that there are some workflows that have main branches that constantly change, as such, it's not ideal to keep changing the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file to reflect that. Having the main branch be a possible build trigger would remove the requirement of having to keep changing the branch every time the main branch changes.
fields.summary: Pipelines main branch trigger

fields.description: The current cache size limit is 1 GB. It would be better to have a larger cache limit. This helps when the dependencies(for instance maven, npm, etc) are huge and save build minutes.
fields.summary: Increase cache limit

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have had a customer raise that they want to customize groups within the "deployment permissions" feature so that this feature is flexible akin to Bamboo. Current the "deployment permissions" feature only allows an option for admins to deploy to certain environments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 # Step 2

h3. Expected Results
h3. N/A
h3. Actual Results
h3. N/A
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Allow non-admin user groups in deployment permissions feature

fields.description:
While using the endpoint `/2.0/repositories/{workspace}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/{pull_request_id}` we are stopped from adding information to Pull Request when a reviewer listed on the API call variables is no longer a member of the workspace.

We would like Bitbucket to proceed and add the valid information on the API call leaving a warning that the given user was not added to the Pull Request, instead of having the call fail.
fields.summary: Adaptive Pull Request Reviewer API call

fields.description:
In our company we use these types of branches:
 * feature/fix branches
 * development branch
 * staging branch
 * production branch

We use different merge strategies to each of them

feature -> development (squash)

development -> staging (commit)

staging -> production (fast forward)

 

Setting default merge strategy globally to any of them causes that for two other merges there is a very high risk of human mistake.

We would love to see some panel like for 'Branch Permissions' where you could set one global merge strategy (as it is now) and different default merge strategies for each of your branches individually.
fields.summary: Set default merge strategy per branch in similar fashion like branch permissions

fields.description: We have some hard-code text string in the xml files in our repo which varies with different environment. Is there a way to replace the hard-code text string in the xml files during the pipeline? For example, run some powershell script during the pipeline?
fields.summary: Replace the text of some files in the repo during pipeline

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer has raised an issue, when viewing projects within a workspace - there is no longer a status icon under the "Builds" column
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click "Projects" on left hand sidebar, select the project within your workspace

h3. Expected Results
 - Build status is visible with a red X or green tick
h3. Actual Results

 * Build status no longer displays:

!image-2021-11-16-13-28-03-378.png!
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing projects no longer shows status icon in "builds" column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Repositories used to be listed on https://bitbucket.org/<workspaceID>/workspace/projects/<ProjectKey> ordered by their names.

A regression was recently introduced where the ordering parameter of this list is now the last updated date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to https://bitbucket.org/<workspaceID>/workspace/projects/<ProjectKey> ordered by their names.
# You should see that the repositories are listed by their last updated date.

h3. Expected Results
Repositories are ordered by their names in alphabetic order

h3. Actual Results
Repositories are ordered by their last updated date.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Regression: Projects page lists repos ordered by "last updated date" instead of by "name"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sometimes when trying to delete a repo it gets stuck on the DELETING state and the user is not able to delete from their side.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to workspace
# Delete a repo
# Sometimes it will get stuck on DELETING state

h3. Expected Results
Repository gets DELETED successfully and is no longer available on the platform

h3. Actual Results
Repository gets stuck on DELETING state and is neither accessible nor deletable

h3. Workaround
Raise a support ticket for manual deletion
fields.summary: Repository gets stuck on DELETING state

fields.description: This feature request is in order to have email notifications triggered to admins on any branch permission change, so this change can be reviewed and approved, avoiding unintended changes to the branch workflow.
fields.summary: Email notifications on any Branch Permission changes

fields.description: I have a user account and a team account and it is impossible to use the same SSH key for both. It is understandable with different user accounts but very annoying with team accounts. Do you intend to allow same ssh keys for user and team accounts?
fields.summary: Same SSH key for different accounts
